item.title: Sewage coming up through grill, 16th December
item.description:
Smelly Sewage coming up through grill on road and on pavement outside 5 Bromley Crescent. I have tried to wash it away, but it came back.

item.title: Opposite 5 Dunmore Rd, 16th December
item.description:
Paint pots and a palette dumped. Also Amazon packaging. Also black bag of household waste dumped on corner Dunmore/Carlisle Rd. A general check on this quiet road is needed as it is a target for fly tippers.

Nearest address to the pin placed on the map (from OS Places API): Dunmore Road, London
Report on FixMyStreet
item.category: Fly-tip Small - Less than one bag

item.title: Loose Household Litter on Public Pavement 9–11 Shipka Roadroperty--, 16th December
item.description:
Litter (including paper waste and plastic bags) was present on the public pavement and roadside across 11 Shipka Road; close to 9 Shipka Road. The waste appears to be loose household/general rubbish rather than construction material, likely due to someone throwing or dropping the plastic bags.

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): 23, Shipka Road, Balham, Greater London

item.title: Mis placed light above sign, 16th December
item.description:
The light that is supposed to be above the one way sign has been knocked by a reversing van. It now points the wrong way - specifically it points in my window so the light is invasive at night. Needs straightening. Outside 32/34 Kenilworth road

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Kenilworth Road, Penge, Greater London

item.title: Insafe charging?, 16th December
item.description:
A resident has plugged into the porch socket to charge their car. Seceond time I've seen it. The cable is a trip hazard, plus I believe it has caused an issue with the door. It's hard to open now. Corner porch Fawcett Estate.
Nearest address to the pin placed on the map (from OS Places API): Clapton Common, Hackney, London

item.title: Cant see sign til you are in the turning, 16th December
item.description:
The signed is hard for people to see. It to flat to the road.. There is a yellow warning sign before junction but it on the red parking zone. Often has vans unloading and buses at busstop. So you then cant see the sign. This needs a rethink.. Thanks

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): 324A, Kennington Lane, Vauxhall, Greater London

item.title: Extremely faded road markings at the pedestrian crossing of Norwood Rd/Half Moon Lane, 16th December
item.description:
I would like to report significantly faded road markings at the multi-arm junction of Half Moon Lane, Dulwich Road, Norwood Road and Milkwood Road, SE24 9HU. This is a complex, high-use junction with heavy pedestrian and cycle movements, and the visibility of key markings (including give-way lines and lane guidance) has deteriorated to the point where it may present a safety risk, particularly in poor light or wet conditions. The junction sits on the Lambeth–Southwark borough boundary. Please assess and, if any of the affected markings fall under Lambeth's responsibility, forward internally to the appropriate highways authority.
Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Half Moon Lane, Dulwich Village, Greater London
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Outside no. 90 Hillway, 16th December
item.description:
Someone or multiple people at that address are constantly leaving a lime bike outside their property. It is either leaning on their fence or on the road, blocking people or cars. I have reported it approx 7 times to lime but they do not do enough to stop the user doing this
Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Hillway, Highgate, Greater London
Report on FixMyStreet
